"Can you ask him"-as in Mark-"to call me back?"
I want Mark to call me back; to telephone

me back. Okay? "Can you ask him", so I have

here: "to call me back". Okay?
That's one way of doing it.

Second way, if I don't need Mark to call me

"Can you just tell Mark that I called?" or "I called"?

"Can you just tell Mark that I called?"

"Can you say that Benjamin

"Wednesday". Okay? Or, I could use a date,

Okay? So I want him to ring me on

"In", "in" is a... He needs to call me in

in this time. If it's the month, then maybe

You don't need to do all of these if you're

"Hello, it's..." If you want to be a

"It's just a little thing. Don't worry. It's not
